title: In Gaza, the fate of thousands missing remains unknown
subhed: In the Palestinian enclave, thousands of families don't know the fate of their loved ones: Some bodies lie beneath the rubble, others were pulverized by the strikes or taken away by the Israeli army.

title: Between Putin and Trump, a similarity born of hatred, contempt and revisionism
Murdered teacher Samuel Paty's family stands united against 'indecent' defense at appeal trial
'The US always promises to extract itself from Middle Eastern quagmires while continuing to get stuck knee-deep'
subhed: After one year in the White House, Donald Trump has ordered more missile and drone strikes than his predecessor did over the entirety of his term, writes Le Monde columnist Gilles Paris.

title: Marine Le Pen's 2027 presidential bid further jeopardized by prosecution at her appeal trial
subhed: By requesting a five-year ban on election to public office on February 3, the prosecution has fueled doubts about Marine Le Pen's ability to run in the 2027 presidential election. The appeals court is due to rule on the case by the summer.

title: 2026 Winter Olympics: Artificial snow takes a toll on the environment
subhed: The Milan Cortina Olympic Games are no exception: Artificial snowmaking will be used almost everywhere. This technology, which requires large amounts of water and energy, has led to major infrastructure changes that have been criticized by environmental advocates and scientists.

title: British mothers fight the slow poison of industrial pollution in Corby
subhed: In Corby, once a major center for the British steel industry, the dismantling of steelworks massively exposed the population to toxic substances, causing widespread pollution, birth defects and pediatric cancers. A group of mothers has waged a long battle to raise national awareness about this major public health issue.

title: Vietnam harbors a profound strategic distrust of the US

title: Iran cracks down on medical workers treating protesters
The US says it deployed a small military team to Nigeria to strengthen the fight against jihadists

Gabriella Papadakis, ice dancer: 'My mother turned me into a little soldier who let herself be guided by the decisions of others'
subhed: 'I wouldn't be where I am today if...' In this series, Le Monde interviews a personality about a decisive moment in their life. The figure skater and former Olympic champion looks back on a childhood filled with constraints in order to succeed in a demanding and conservative environment.

title: A bike journey across crisis-ridden Cuba under the watchful eye of state security
subhed: 'Cuba, an island adrift' (3/3). Le Monde reporters left Havana by bicycle to discover this country where people, under constant surveillance, have learned to survive through resourcefulness and the black market.

title: Mark Carney, a prime minister seeking to free Canada from US dominance
subhed: As the international order weakens, the Canadian leader has moved on from the Trudeau era, when his predecessor was seen as naive on the world stage, and to assert himself against hegemonic powers – starting with his American neighbor.

title: The end of US-Russia nuclear treaty is a dangerous signal for deterrance
